New Records: Domantas Sabonis set a new Sacramento Kings record with 28 rebounds in a single game, breaking the previous record of 26 rebounds set by himself and Chris Webber
Key Match Events: The Sacramento Kings held the Boston Celtics to a strong defensive performance, limiting them to 11/41 from three-point range
Domantas Sabonis recorded 23 points, 28 rebounds, and three assists on 10/15 shooting from the field and 3/4 from three-point range
Pre-Game Insights: The Sacramento Kings were riding a six-game winning streak and had a 5-1 record since naming Doug Christie as interim head coach
Post-Match Reflections: The Sacramento Kings extended their win streak to six with a convincing 114-97 victory over the Boston Celtics
Domantas Sabonis' dominant performance and the team's defensive efforts were key factors in the win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sacramento Kings have not won seven consecutive games since November 9-22, 2022, when they were introduced as the 'Beam Team'
The Kings are now 5-0 in the NBA rankings since January 1, with strong performances in offensive and defensive categories
